title: Mental Health America
description: A nonprofit organization dedicated to addressing the needs of those living with mental illness and promoting mental health.

title: Calm
description: A mindfulness and meditation app that offers guided meditations, sleep stories, and other tools to reduce stress and improve mental well-being.

title: Headspace
description: A meditation and mindfulness app that provides guided meditations, mindfulness exercises, and sleep content to help users reduce stress and improve overall well-being.

title: Student Health 101
description: An online magazine that provides college students with information and resources on a variety of health and wellness topics, including physical health, mental health, and sexual health.

title: Active Minds
description: A nonprofit organization that empowers students to speak openly about mental health in order to educate others and encourage help-seeking.

title: Planned Parenthood
description: A nonprofit organization that provides sexual and reproductive health care, education, and advocacy, including services for college students.

title: Campus Recreation
description: Provides information and resources for college students to access campus recreation facilities, intramural sports, and fitness classes to promote physical activity and overall wellness.

title: Nutrition.gov
description: A website that provides information and resources on nutrition, healthy eating, and food safety, with specific content for college students.

title: College Health and Wellness
description: A comprehensive resource that covers a wide range of health and wellness topics for college students, including physical health, mental health, sexual health, and substance abuse.

title: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline
description: A free, 24-hour hotline available to anyone in suicidal crisis or emotional distress, including college students.

title: The Trevor Project
description: A nonprofit organization that provides crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ young people, including college students.

title: CDC - College Health and Safety
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's website with information and resources on a variety of health and safety topics for college students.

title: Nourish
description: A wellness app that provides college students with personalized nutrition and fitness plans, as well as mindfulness and mental health support.

title: College Cooking
description: A website and cookbook that provides budget-friendly, easy-to-make recipes and cooking tips for college students to promote healthy eating.

title: Sanvello
description: A mental health app that offers evidence-based coping tools, community support, and personalized care plans for college students struggling with anxiety, depression, and other mental health issues.

title: ACHA - American College Health Association
description: A professional association dedicated to advancing the health of college students and campus communities through advocacy, education, and research.

title: American Red Cross
description: Provides first aid, CPR, and other health and safety training and resources for college students, including emergency preparedness.

title: Healthy Minds Network
description: A research network and online resource center that focuses on improving the mental health and well-being of college students.

title: Omada Health
description: A digital health program that helps college students and young adults develop healthy habits, manage chronic conditions, and improve overall well-being.

title: Healthy Eating on Campus
description: A comprehensive guide from the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics with tips and resources for college students to maintain a balanced, nutritious diet.

title: RAINN National Sexual Assault Hotline
description: A free, confidential hotline that provides 24/7 support and resources for survivors of sexual assault, including college students.

title: Movember
description: A global men's health movement that focuses on raising awareness and funding for issues like prostate cancer, testicular cancer, mental health, and suicide prevention, particularly among college-aged men.

title: National Eating Disorders Association
description: A nonprofit organization that provides information, resources, and support for individuals and families affected by eating disorders, including college students.

title: ACHA-NCHA - National College Health Assessment
description: A national survey administered by the American College Health Association that collects data on the health, behaviors, and perceptions of college students.

title: Student Health 101 Magazine
description: A digital magazine that covers a wide range of health and wellness topics for college students, including physical health, mental health, sexual health, and substance abuse.

title: Fit University
description: A website and online community that provides college students with fitness and nutrition resources, including workout plans, healthy recipes, and tips for staying active on campus.

title: Therapy for Black Girls
description: An online space dedicated to encouraging the mental wellness of Black girls and women, including college students, through content, resources, and a therapist directory.

title: Body Positive
description: A nonprofit organization that promotes body acceptance, self-love, and healthy body image among college students and young adults.

title: Wellness Wheel
description: A comprehensive framework for holistic health and wellness, with resources and tools for college students to assess and improve their overall well-being.

title: Healthy Minds Study
description: An annual survey that examines mental health, service utilization, and related issues among undergraduate and graduate students in the United States.
